Articles.Content:
I used to have Win7 home with 16g ram

today I have Win7 professional with 64g ram.

Now the only thing missing is KSP 1.1 64bit version !

Are you Ready ?

64gigs I quite overkill unless you do heavy video editing or work with extremely large images that you process...

But to answer your question,.my build:

CPU: i7 4790K overclocked at 4.5Ghz

RAM: 16GB HyperX Fury ocverclocked @ 2400

Motherboard: MSI Z97-GD65 Gaming board

GPU: 2x Radeon HD 5830's crossfired and overclocked

PSU: Thermaltake 750W

HDD #1: 1TB Western Digital Black

HDD #2: Three Spinpoint S4's in RAID 0 config

Case: Coolermaster CM690II lined with sound-deadening Spire Soundpad matting on both side panels

Case Cooling: 5 fans for case controlled by Scythe fan controller

CPU Cooling: CPU is watercooled with Corsair H80i watercooler.

So.... Yes, yes I am.

Since I'm running 64-bit Linux Mint I have been ready.

Since like, 0.22 or something.

Since I'm running OS-X 10.10 I'll never be ready.

No, scratch that. I'm on Windows 10 for gaming now, though I've only got 16 GBs of RAM. Really don't expect to hit that cap, but upgrading is pretty cheap if I do. I don't even hit 16GBs when editing video on the MacBook.
